did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Material relating to Constance Cook's tenure as a New York State Assemblyperson.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Constance Cook received her B.A. (Class of 1941) and L.L.B. from Cornell University (1943). She was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1962. She was a Republican from the 128th Assembly District (Tompkins, Yates, and part of Seneca County). She held the post of vice president for land grant affairs at Cornell University from 1976-1980. Among her legislative accomplishments was co-authoring a bill signed into law that legalized abortion in New York three years before the Roe v. Wade decision by the Supreme Court of the United States in 1973 legalized the practice nationwide.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Material relating to Constance Cook's tenure as a New York State Assemblyperson, including her signature abortion legislation and other legislative and constituent files. Also, material relating to her position on Cornell University's Board of Trustees; local history files; and legislation concerning education.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Names of authors of personal correspondence not to be used until November 27, 1984, except with permission of donor or author.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Constance Cook papers, #2881. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Not all the material in the collection is covered by this guide.
